charBitOp.description:
Description

When using 'char' variables in bit operations, sign extension can generate unexpected results. For example:\012    char c = 0x80;\012    int i = 0 | c;\012    if (i & 0x8000)\012        printf("not expected");\012The "not expected" will be printed on the screen.
charBitOp.option:
Static analysis does not have options.

Severity: warning
CWE: 398
Inconclusive: false
